attributes.action: Use all National Lottery profits to help fund National Health Service
attributes.background: It is clear that our NHS is overstretched and desperately requires additional funding. There is, in my opinion, no more worthy a cause for National Lottery money to be spent on. It is my belief that tens of thousands additional tickets would be purchased for this cause.
attributes.additional_details: Having put this idea to many people over recent months the general consensus is that most people, like me, would be happy to invest £10 per week if we knew the money was going to the NHS.

attributes.action: Investigate the risk to health from formaldehyde insulation in 1m older UK homes
attributes.background: As a social housing tenant in a former council owned property, now managed by a housing trust, I only discovered that it's cavity wall insulation contains formaldehyde (a known carcinogenic) when contractors negligently blew this noxious powder into my home & exposed us to its ongoing health risks!
attributes.additional_details:
Upon exposure to this atomised irritant, it was blasted into my home under 3,000 psi of machine fed pressure, I initially suffered a severe burning sensation in my eyes, nose, throat & chest, which continued to cause much discomfort for approx. 6 weeks afterwards; some of my neighbours were similarly affected.

On researching the topic I've discovered up to 1m older UK homes may be at risk of this hidden toxin & the EU's listed this substance as a contributory factor to leukemia & nasal cancer.

attributes.action: Scrap the drivers CPC
attributes.background: Now we are leaving the European Union we should scrap the drivers CPC as it stops people getting back into driving jobs unless they complete this pointless course that can be about anything from healthy eating to general health and safety also a waste of my time and money.

attributes.action: Restrict the public sale of fireworks to silent firework types
attributes.background: When it comes to Guy Fawkes night and New Years Eve the disturbance created by the sale of fireworks is extreme. The general public should only be able to purchase "silent fireworks" to limit the inconvenience they cause. Pets and people of nervous disposition experience terror during this time.
attributes.additional_details: My pet dog absolutely hates the time of year when Fireworks are let off, the sale of explosive fireworks should be banned and replaced with "silent fireworks" which are available on the Continent. This would allow people to enjoy the firework displays without disturbance to animals and people with young children. Restrict the sale of industrial strength explosive fireworks to licenced displays only

attributes.action: To make it a legal human right for every UK citizen to have a home.
attributes.background: Homelessness is increasing, human beings should not be living on the streets in the 21st Century. The United Kingdom is a first world country and as a civilised advanced country we should no longer tolerate homelessness for any reason.

attributes.action: Ban unconditional offers for entrance to university
attributes.background: Universities have embarked on a race to the bottom in admissions standards in a now liberalised marketplace. To benefit society, the free market needs a framework of rules within which to operate. The government should legislate to prohibit this harmful practice, which is damaging pupil attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of unconditional offers for entrance to university made to 18 year olds in England, Wales and N.I. is exploding:

2013      3,000
2014    12,100
2015    23,400
2016    36,800
2017    51,600

UCAS recorded one in six applicants receiving one or more unconditional offers in 2017.

Such offers remove the incentive for pupils to work, leading to lower attainment at A Level, as UCAS' own research has demonstrated: see pages 18-9 of https://www.ucas.com/file/71796/download?token=D4uuSzur.

attributes.action: Philip Hammond to withdraw comments on disabled workforce lowering productivity
attributes.background: On the 6.12.17 the chancellor said to MPs at the Treasury Select Committee: "It is almost certainly the case that by increasing participation in the workforce for example of disabled people[...]may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements."
attributes.additional_details:
Rather than scapegoating disabled people through unfounded simplistic claims around a pretty complex matter Mr Hammond would benefit from reading this DWP commissioned report:

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20130314010347/http:/research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd5/rports2005-2006/rrep400.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwj-yP3UlYrYAhVI4KQKHd_mBpc4ChAWCCowAg&usg=AOvVaw3_mgkcqqS4_rwRlzoHoH3N

attributes.action: Provide PIP for ALL type 1 diabetics who make a claim
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes falls under the definition of a disability under the Equality Act 2010, which defines a disability as ‘a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial long-term negative effect on a person’s ability to carry out normal day-to-day activities’. PIP should be awarded to all T1D

attributes.action: Stop involvement in the Afghan, Syrian and Iraqi Wars and bring troops home
attributes.background: Our involvement as the UK to stop the ongoing wars is the problem.  People are unhappy that we are continuously involved in the different wars and spending too much money on the wars when we could spend it on something useful in the UK. This is a major problem and could assist other campaigns
attributes.additional_details: We are spending a net amount of at least £20.3 billion just until 2010 (combined of only the cost of the afghan and Iraqi war).Many sources state that we are spending at least 37 billion by 2017 a statement by guardian stated “By 2020, Britain will have spent at least £40bn on its Afghan campaign, enough to recruit over 5,000 police officers or nurses and pay for them throughout their careers. It could fund free tuition for all students in British higher education for 10 years."

attributes.action: Limit alcohol labels and add warnings
attributes.background: Make alcohol branding limited to standard labels and add warnings to the label of future effects and long term illnesses.

attributes.action: Eliminate Tax Avoidance - Introduce 2% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: As an example, eBay’s total UK revenue last year was c£1bn and £1.6m in corporation tax was paid. This petition would see eBay pay a minimum £20m (12.5 times more).  All companies regardless of size would be forced to pay their fair share of tax including Apple, Amazon, Google and Starbucks.
attributes.additional_details:
It is reasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated equally and the minimum corporation tax rate on turnover should be the price they pay.

The minimum corporation tax could be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.

Incidentally, FTSE 100 companies, on average, have seen their corporation tax expense to turnover go from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years.

attributes.action: Ban nut products by supermarket checkouts promoted for impulsive purchasing.
attributes.background: For those with severe nut allergies such as myself, avoiding the nut aisle in a supermarket is usually easy, however having to dodge them at the checkout where supermarkets promote impulsive buying, makes shopping in general increasingly difficult and potentially dangerous.
attributes.additional_details: I've noticed more and more that supermarkets are stocking shelves at the checkout with nut products to encourage shoppers to purchase them impulsively. Although impulse buying is not something that concerns me, having to weave through the already narrow area to pay for your shopping to avoid having an allergy attack seems totally unnecessary, which is why I think that nut products should only be sold on an aisle in the shop, and not used as a product to promote impulsive buying at the checkout.

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into why the UK issued new, lower alcohol guidelines
attributes.background: It appears that the Guidelines Development Group responsible for the new 2016 alcohol intake guidelines contained a large number of people from temperance groups. This suggests that science could have been manipulated to support an anti-alcohol agenda, rather than produce evidence-based guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government should set up a public inquiry to examine the research and how the new guidelines were produced.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT rate on fixed telephone lines and broadband
attributes.background:
Telephone lines with broadband are an essential utility for the 21st century.

Currently there is a 20% VAT levied on all services, other essential utilities are not subject to such a high rate of taxation.
attributes.additional_details:
The government is well aware of the benefits of a connected society and documents them extensively: https://www.gov.uk/government/policies/broadband-investment

Individuals and businesses benefit massively from internet and telephone connectivity and this in turn benefits our economy.

Other utilities which are essential, such as water, electricity and gas are subject to reduced rates of taxation. Telephone and broadband services should be treated the same, as an essential utility.

attributes.action: Make Tv licences free for students studying Media and/or television.
attributes.background: Living in London and being a student is expensive. That, combined with the low maintenance loans, budgeting is a big part of being a student. Paying £147 a year to watch television, that is involved in our study, means a lot of people don't have access to this resource due to their budget.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of media students I have spoken to have also gone without a television licence which has affected their study. However, students are not willing to break the law and pay the £1000 fine, just to help improve their research and their grade.

attributes.action: Make spent conviction dismissals a protected right for -2 years in employment
attributes.background: Having recently been dismissed for having a spent conviction despite the protection under the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1979. Under employment law this action is unlawful and would lead to an automatic unfair dismissal if an individual has 2 years service. This action is discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Sec 4 of the rehabilitation of offenders act 1979 makes it unlawful to be sacked simply for not disclosing a spent conviction, yet there is no penalty or recourse for the rehabilitated person to take action against this form of discrimination!  
As this is already listed as an automatic unfair dismissal, then it should be looked at to decrease the requirement of 2 years service and treat it the same as the other protected reasons such as whistleblowing, discrimination etc.

attributes.action: All government agencies to stop using marital status titles for women
attributes.background:
Current marital status title's for women: Miss – unmarried Mrs – married Ms – divorced. 

Propose to replace with Ms only to indicate a female. This is aligned with Mr to indicate a male.
attributes.additional_details:
A women's place in society is no longer dictated by her marital status. 

Requesting marital status on all applications/forms has no relevance and the government agencies should update this archaic practise and be brought in line and equal with men, where only a gender acknowledgement is required.

attributes.action: Change Corporation tax so that only UK costs can be used to offset profits.
attributes.background: In the last week it has been reported that Ebay UK and AirBnB have both paid significantly less corporation tax than would seem fair, both have acted within the law that allows costs from abroad to be used against profits achieved in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: By only allowing costs incurred in the UK for UK tax purposes this would level the playing field, deter replacing of UK jobs with jobs in lower cost countries and improve tax revenues. This would also align with PAYE tax rules.

attributes.action: Urge the British Government to recognise the Armenian tragedy as a genocide
attributes.background: I believe that my country was a beacon of hope and righteousness (being a descendant of holocaust survivors), but knowing that this is such an injustice has made me feel so utterly depressed that I no longer feel pride for my country, as it takes trade deals with Turkey over British moral principles
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/359550/FOI_ref_0298-14_Attachment_29.pdf

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance that IVA completion certificates should be issued promptly
attributes.background: An IVA makes people live on a tight budget for 5 years in an effort to pay back what they can. These people can't start to rebuild their lives or their credit rating until they get their completion certificate. This currently takes months and sometimes over 6 months. We suggest it should be 30 days.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.iva.co.uk/iva-completion-certificates-petition

attributes.action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) from 39 weeks to 52 weeks
attributes.background: It is important that new parents should not be put off taking their full entitlement to Maternity Leave for 52 weeks because they will not receive payment for the last 13 weeks of their leave. Currently SMP is only payable for the first 39 weeks of Maternity Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
The House of Commons Library contains a document entitled "Maternity pay and leave" dated 13 January 2010. It states that in December 2004 the Government announced a goal of extending maternity pay to twelve
months, from what was then 26 weeks (6 months). Although progress has been made and maternity pay is now paid for 39 weeks (9 months), I believe it is an important social issue to get that extra extension to 52 weeks (12 months).

attributes.action: Change the TV licensing law so that your TV licence covers you away from home.
attributes.background:
If you have a licence and travel on a bus whilst watching iPlayer you are covered. If you live or holiday in a caravan you are covered. 
If you stay in a hotel, B&B or holiday home you ARE NOT and require the owner of that establishment to have a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
You could be potentially breaking the law without even realising it.
I am one of those many law abiding citizens who have to work away from home due to lack of suitable work in my home area. I own a TV licence at home. During the week I rent a cottage off my employer. I have no utility bills, do not have the right to vote in this constituency and I am not registered with a GP here and yet I am required, by law, to have a TV licence - Why?
If you think that this should be changed please vote.

attributes.action: Make health workers exempt from parking tickets when delivering a public service
attributes.background: Allow domiciliary carers, emergency services, District nurses and doctors to park on single or double yellow lines when carrying out a health service for the public in their own homes.
attributes.additional_details: Care workers,District nurse,emergency services&doctors find it difficult to park when delivering a care service.if they display a notice,when parked on yellow lines, explaining they're there for a reason,they should be exempt from parking tickets within a certain time frame.The health services are under massive constraints&strains&are extremely limited to time,Parking issues need to be addressed. Councils pay for care to be delivered but penalise those very people when parking is unavailable.

attributes.action: Changes required under the Universal Credit to support workers!
attributes.background:
make uploading documentation for childcare costs or any other evidence available online - this will enable working families to upload in a timely manner!

monies to be paid in advance for childcare costs as ALL nurseries UK wide require advance payment!!
attributes.additional_details: I am a single mother to 2 under 3's who works as a manager but is newly single and having to rely on a system whether the childcare costs and housing costs have not been paid for the last 2 months leaving me in a very difficult situation that nobody else (IN WORK) SHOULD GO THROUGH!

attributes.action: Stop introducing fixed tenancies to tenants
attributes.background: New legislation is putting forward that fixed term tenancies will be given to everyone who is signing a new tenancy. This means tenants with existing secure tenancies will loose their secure tenancy example through mutual exchange and through the bidding system.
attributes.additional_details: Tenants are given opportunity to move through mutual exchange and being forced to give up their secure tenancy because they need extra space or to downsize. Now it’s a choice of quality of living or a secure tenancy. With these new laws coming in no one is secure people with vulnerability should be excempt from these laws. It would be better that those who need to move through mutual exchange should keep their existing tenancy status ie secure tenancy and move that over to the swapper property.

attributes.action: Re-run the appointments process for the board of the Office for Students
attributes.background: The Commissioner for Public Appointments has identified serious governance failings and political interference in the appointment of board members of the new Office for Students. All board members should be asked to immediately resign and the appointments process be re-run in  proper manner.
attributes.additional_details: The full report of the Commissioner can be accessed here: https://publicappointmentscommissioner.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Commissioner-for-Public-Appointments-Investigation-OFS-Final-.pdf

attributes.action: The immigration amnesty of Grenfell survivors should be indefinitely extended
attributes.background: ‘Foreign’ survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire were granted a temporary 12-month immigration “amnesty” for them to stay in the U.K. regardless of their immigration status but may still face deportation after that.

attributes.action: Put retirement age back to 60 for females and 60 for men.
attributes.background: I am 58 years old. Working with all sorts of conditions: COPD; Glucoma; 2 bad discs; Arthritis. To try and get time off to see a doctor is almost impossible. Getting up is a struggle. But I am not entitled to disability as I can dress wash and feed myself. Everyday is a struggle.

attributes.action: No foreign aid to Pakistan for supporting terrorism.
attributes.background: Pakistan soil has become a training camp for terrorists. The government of Pakistan have been supporting terrorists; UK foreign aid therefore goes to terrorists. Government must immediately stop all foreign aid to Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details: On one hand, they show that they have taken action to tackle terrorism; on the other hand, they support terrorism for their own gain. Granting foreign aid to Pakistan seems as if we are financially supporting the terrorists. Many terrorist-related events in Afghanistan, India and other countries are initiated in Pakistan. Recent bomb blasts in Afghanistan killed hundreds of innocent people.

attributes.action: Mandatory professional assessments for mental health decisions in organisations
attributes.background: Studying and working in the the field of mental health, I have seen both loved ones and service users lose out on employment opportunities and even be removed from positions due to misunderstanding and lay person judgement of their condition. This should not happen, and doesn't for other disability.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst it is currently possible to argue a duty of care motive for treating those with a diagnosed mental health condition differently; whether this is the case should be reviewed by a mental health professional. Otherwise, limitations placed on an individual can constitute disability discrimination. This is not currently mandatory, with occupational health doing this job if anyone. This is more true in voluntary organisations where loss of role is not termination of employment.

attributes.action: Ban the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: To be made law that all public buildings in the UK to fly the Union Flag
attributes.background: Many countries around the world take pride in their national flag it seems the that UK is almost afraid to fly its flag for the fear of upsetting someone. After BREXIT we will once again be an independent country and should fly our flag as often and conspicuously as possible on all public buildings

attributes.action: Abolish Political Parties and create a collective body of independent MPs.
attributes.background: Great ideas can come from anyone. The possibility that a great idea will fall by the wayside due to some in-built bias of the current Party political/adversarial setup is wrong. Our current Parliamentary system encourages and rewards political bullying (from the whips) and loyalty to the Party line.
attributes.additional_details: Independent MPs would strengthen the relationship (and possibly form new types of relationships) between MPs and their constituents. An MP who today finds it necessary to follow the Party line, which in many cases is against their constituents beliefs, will find it easier to be more in tune with the people they represent and 100% accountable to the same. We have had enough of adversarial wrangling and it is time to try something new - a collective Parliament as is evident anywhere else in nature

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory maximum speed limiters on all vehicles driven on UK roads.
attributes.background: Most production cars & motorcycles manufactured today are capable of speeds well in excess of 70 mph with some high performance models able to reach up to 155mph.
attributes.additional_details: Criminals ignore speed limits and we regularly see news reports of police pursuing stolen high performance cars in excess of 100mph with some causing deaths and injuries. It is illegal to drive above the speed limit. Why are cars that can travel over the maximum legal speed limit allowed on our roads? The new range of Ford Fiestas have maximum speeds of between 99 and 121mph (Autocar). I am calling for compulsory top speed  limiters to be fitted to all vehicles used on UK roads to save lives.

attributes.action: Persistent drunk drivers with 3 or more should be banned from driving for life.
attributes.background: Norfolk Police have arrested 57 people in 9 days for driving over the limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are repeat drink driving offenders.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-24281043

Too many persistent offenders serve a short ban and are then able to reapply for their licences. For those who are clearly never going to learn we need the ultimate sanction. Fines and imprisonment are not enough. A lifetime driving ban will keep the roads safe for the vast majoriry of sensible drivers.

attributes.action: Require Train Companies to refund and/or exchange advance-purchase train tickets
attributes.background: Trains do not refund or even at least exchange advance purchase tickets. There is no economic value to society or benefit to the customer for this. If people's plans change, or they mistakenly book the wrong date, they should be allowed to refund it within a certain timeframe.
attributes.additional_details: You can't get a refund on an advance purchase ticket months in advance, unless you exchange it for another advance purchase ticket at the cost of £10. This is not fair for consumers. This is simply companies trying to squeeze out every penny they can from the consumer. Megabus charge £1 to change your tickets, but trains charge £10, and if you're train ticket is around £10 - £30 anyway, on balance it's cheaper buying a new one. This would also help trains stop overreserving seats in carriages too.

attributes.action: Pay reparations to Caribbean descendants of slavery.
attributes.background: The British government owes Caribbean people reparations for the horrors carried out on black people during slavery. The sugar cane plantations helped to fund many cooperations still in existence today, these families cam be traced and great Britain should be held accountable for its atrocities.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: To require each energy supplier to set a standard Standing Charge across tariffs
attributes.background: Energy suppliers offer multiple tariffs, which are likely to have different combinations of unit price and daily standing charge. Making an informed decision about WHICH tariff and/or supplier to use is made more complex by having these differences. Unit only variables would simplify that choice.
attributes.additional_details: I've just been through the process again, spent hours doing many calculations and making comparisons between, not only one energy supplier's tariffs, but also between multiple suppliers, it was confusing and impossible to make an informed choice. I consulted acquaintances, friends and family, who all agreed. Having just ONE standard daily standing charge would make such choice simpler by removing one variable. Switching may be ideal in principle, but is often a leap in the dark for many people.

attributes.action: Make tax incentives and laws for companies allowing people to work  from home.
attributes.background: Because a lot of people travel into work in cities we are overloading the traffic infrastructure, creating pollution. parking problems and destroying country villages. Give companies incentives to allow them to support home workers, remove laws making companies for being responsible for home areas.
attributes.additional_details: companies are made responsible for the environment that people are working in at home, allow workers to opt out of this protection so they can work at home. Companies should only be responsible for the computers and equipment they supply nothing else. this will allow people with children to work from home. also companies can use more part time workers.

attributes.action: Change the way fines i.e. Speeding/Drunk and Disorderly are calculated.
attributes.background: Instead of a fixed price fine we should have a proportional fine so it affects each person the same way, it should be 10% of the offending persons average weekly wage (10% of 1/52th, 1 weeks worth, of last year's net pay) or a minimum of £80, whichever is the greater.
attributes.additional_details:
This way it have much more of an equal affect upon the culprit and even out some balance of a unfair prosecution system which effects the poorest more.

For example in October this year (2017) a professional footballer was caught speeding and was fined £440, alot of money for a person on minimum wage but does not have the same impact on someone reportedly earning £37,500 per week. This may be an extreme example however I feel this change allow punishment to be felt equally across the board.

attributes.action: Hold a Public Inquiry into >45000 extra deaths linked to austerity since 2010
attributes.background: A recent study published in the BMJ showed a correlation between cuts to social and healthcare funding and higher than expected national mortality rates since 2010. A Public Inquiry should be held in order to determine whether Government Austerity measures have led to an increase in death rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Long term under funding of health and social care services has led to widespread suffering, a decline physical and mental health and vulnerable people being put at risk. Lack of funding may also be responsible for >45000 deaths since 2010. If this is the case, harmful government action and policy must be reversed and responsible politicians held to account over these deaths.

Study: http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/7/11/e017722

attributes.action: Increase the funding for additional support for prison officers well-being.
attributes.background:
Prison officers are in a highly demanding and challenging job that requires readily available support systems in terms of both their mental health and well-being. 
We are petitioning for:
More counselling with independent professional counsellors to deal with mental health in the work place.
attributes.additional_details:
7159 assaults on prison officers and serious assaults on prison officers has trebled from previous year (MOJ, 2017); impacting their psychological and physical safety at work, overall effecting the prison system in whole.
We think this intervention would be beneficial for prison officers, prisoners and society as a whole.

attributes.action: Move pedestrian crossing buttons further away from roadside for safety.
attributes.background: I believe that the position of 'Crossing Buttons' is too near the road. Children often run towards the button, wanting to be the one that presses it. A trip or stumble could easily result in them falling into the road or cause a motorist to swerve/brake etc. Bringing risk of accident or fatality.

attributes.action: Call for all people who mentally cause suicide to be prosecuted for MURDER
attributes.background:
This petition calls for 'murder' to be redefined so that if it can be proven that one person has committed suicide as a result of another person's/ other people's actions, a murder charge can result.
The punishment will be a starting point of a minimum of 15 years in prison (12 years for under 18s)
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are killing themselves due to other people's evil actions. There is currently no crime that has been committed.
Manslaughter is 'the crime of killing a human being without malice aforethought'. That basically means that if you physically kill somebody without intent or the mental capacity to understand your actions.
To force a person to suicide, a person must have such great intent to harm others. There is malice! Murder could be 'killing a human deliberately or due to bullying'

attributes.action: Make it illegal to kill llamas in slaughterhouses.
attributes.background: It is actually legal to kill and eat llama if it is killed in an approved slaughterhouse. We personally love llamas and would like to make it illegal for llamas to be killed.

attributes.action: Make food labels clearly state if the product is suitable for vegetarians.
attributes.background: With an estimated 2% of the population of Britain being vegetarian, many people will know the stuggle of scanning through every ingredient on a label trying to work out if they are able to eat the product. With this information so easily known to the manufacturers, it is time for this burden to end.
attributes.additional_details: I have been a vegetarian for over 10 years now and have constantly had trouble while shopping to see if I can actually eat the food on the shelves. I have even had to use my phone in store and search online for this simple answer, and many other families will know this struggle. When it looks like half of the ingredients on food labels now are chemicals I've never even heard of, it seems illogical for the consumer to have to go out of their way to find a simple, but essential, yes or no answer.

attributes.action: Minimum tax rate for tax avoiders -Raise ££bn extra tax for health and education
attributes.background: The introduction of a 15% minimum income tax rate for an individual or company would raise tens of billions in additional tax receipts each year to help fund health, education and social care without the need to raise existing tax rates, cut funding elsewhere or to borrow more money.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, tax avoiders can legally reduce the tax liability on their income to next to nothing without any restriction.
Any individual or company who resides or operates within the UK and uses a known avoidance scheme or has connected parties or subsidiaries registered in a tax jurisdiction where the effective tax rate is less than 15% should pay the new minimum tax rate.  This will apply to UK income and all income recorded in these jurisdictions whether or not it is remitted back to UK.

attributes.action: Formally support UN condemnation of the Saudi bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera.
attributes.background: A UN High Commissioner has condemned the Saudi-led bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera as an "unacceptable attack on the right to freedom of expression and opinion". The government should explicitly support the UN and oppose the Salman regime's attempt to censor TV channels available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UN High Commissioner is Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein:
http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/06/high-commissioner-zeid-raad-al-hussein-call-shut-al-jazeera-unacceptable-attack-170630111642647.html

It is unacceptable to tolerate Saudi interference in what British audiences should be permitted to watch. The government should issue a formal declaration of support for the UN and unequivocally repudiate such Saudi meddling in our sources of news. It is not for the Saudis to censor our television channels.

attributes.action: To make labeling commercial food as vegetarian and/or vegan a legal requirement
attributes.background: Some products on assumption may appear vegetarian/vegan, but when read closely they contain traces of animal produce. It seems reasonable to impose this requirement on the grounds that collectively speaking,it is incredibly time consuming not to mention unpractical for those who require visual aid.
